climbs.name: Wild Turkey Sunrise
climbs.fa: Mike McEwen, Dave Baker, Steve Grossman,'

content.description: This is an awesome looking line but it is as chossy as they get.  It may have been solid when first done but the fire (I am guessing) trashed it.  Lots of rock has popped off and the rock just isn't solid anymore.  It is fun to top-rope but I would not suggest leading it.
Balancy cruxes make this an interesting journey.  Bakerized to force you left out to an arete with a hard move to finish the sequence.
content.location: Starts on a left angling hand rail

content.description: First third is not so good but the last two thirds make up for it.  Fun moves on an arete but you might want to do harder moves left of the arete if the holds on the right side cannot be reached.
content.location: Climb a crack on the S. Face of the formation until you can traverse right at a bolt then climb past two more bolts to the start of the arete.

content.description: Cool face climbing to a great roof finish.  You better know how to hand jam.
content.location: Left end of Pyramid it starts in a crack that leads to the ledge then up a shallow arete.

content.description: A good safe lead. Very well protected trad route that is either 5.7 or 5.9. Start by traversing in from the left on a big ledge or doing a steeper harder 5.9 direct start. Standard rack up to #4 Camalot.  The 5.9 direct is a bit chossy but has decent pro.
content.protection: Standard to light rack with a # 4 Camalot.
content.location: Starts left of center in some short cracks to a ledge then follow the cracks.

content.description: This is a small crag that face mostly east.  It is about 65 feet tall with a number of crack system and some aretes on the left end.  Not a lot of climbs here but it is a nice spot and you will have it to yourself.
